subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Power function
Inverse square law

li.p: A negative exponent denotes a reciprocal: a^{-n} = \dfrac{1}{a^n}, if a\ne 0.
Any number (except zero) raised to the zero power is 1: a^0 = 1, if a\ne 0.
A function of the form f (x) = kx^p, where k and p are constants, is called a power function.
Write a power function for "y varies inversely with the cube of x."?
Explain why it makes sense to define 10^0 = 1.
Why is zero excluded from the domain of f (x) = 3x^{-2}?
Choose a value for to show that the following statement is false: 2x^{-2} + 4^{x-1} = 6^{x-3} \hphantom{00000}\text{False!}
